txt.en: 'You have the soil! Wonderful! I will take it and put it in the planter with my seeds while you get water from the well.'
Gêna has asked you to go to the Usâl and fill four sacks with soil from the dried river-bed. You have collected the soil and should bring it to Gêna in Western Khanâg.
Collect sacks of dry river-bed dirt from the sediment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Gêna has asked you to go to the Usâl and fill four bags with soil from the dried river-bed.
Collected sacks of dry river-bed dirt from the sediment ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Thank you for all of your help, [placeholder]. It will be exciting to see if the traveller spoke true, and the soil from a dry river-bed is indeed better for gardens.'
Bring water from the well for the newly planted seeds
You have collected the sediment Gêna asked for and delivered it to her. She will put it in the planter with the seeds while you get a bucket of water from the well.
The planter has been filled with soil, seeded, and watered. You should talk to Gêna.
Bring the sacks of dirt to Gêna in Western Khanâg
Gêna would like to attempt some container gardening using soil from the dry river-bed of the Usâl.

'Hashtal-gûr, may I ask you a favour?\n\n'Another traveller told me once that the soil from a dried river-bed is very good for growing fruits and vegetables. I have this large planter and would like to try it, but I am not brave enough to go to the Usâl. Would you be willing to go to the old river-bed and collect some soil for me? Four of these sacks should do.'
